definition: (of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow

sentences.english: And she had a dictation with me this evening.
sentences.chinese: 今天晚上，她和我一块听写了那些内容。

sentences.english: The French teacher dictates to the class every other week.
sentences.chinese: 法语教师每隔一周给这班学生做一次听写。

sentences.english: She dictated the rest content of lesson 79 this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午，她听写了第七十九课余下的内容。

sentences.english: And then I dictated the lyric once.
sentences.chinese: 然后，我听写了一遍歌词。

sentences.english: Of course, I dictated the lyric of this song, too.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我也听写了这首歌曲的歌词。

sentences.english: The teacher gave us a French dictation.
sentences.chinese: 老师给我们作了一次法语听写。

sentences.english: She dictated what she reviewed this evening.
sentences.chinese: 晚上，她听写了自己复习过的内容。

sentences.english: Before she went to bed, she dictated the content which she reviewed this evening.
sentences.chinese: 在她上床睡觉之前，她听写了今天晚上所复习的内容。

sentences.english: To put it more plainly, is the text dictation, typing in the computer.
sentences.chinese: 说得更直白一些，就是听写，把文字敲进电脑里。

sentences.english: The teacher dictated in Spanish to her class.
sentences.chinese: 教师给全班学生做西班牙语听写。

sentences.english: The teacher dictated a passage to the class.
sentences.chinese: 老师让全班学生听写了一段文章。
请把你们的听写交上来。

sentences.english: This morning I went out after an English dictation exercise.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上起来听写完一段英语就出门了。

sentences.english: Then she had a dictation by herself.
sentences.chinese: 接着，她自己又完成了听写。

sentences.english: This fits with Kierkegaard's characteristic tendency to avoid dictating answers.
sentences.chinese: 这符合克尔凯郭尔的特点趋势，以避免听写答案。

definition: new word (in textbook)/word that is unfamiliar or not yet studied/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]
new character (in textbook)/character that is unfamiliar or not yet studied
to pronounce a word after mentally processing its spelling/(phonics) blending
